You understand that it's easier to balance champions who have click-ons/auto-targets than it is people with skillshots, right? Because their damage output is consistent and thus is easy to read.

I wouldn't say that this is the case.

Champs who have nothing but autotargets tend to be rather hard to balance,because these champs have to pay for this reliability with power.
Meaning a champ with lots of click-ons/auto-targets will be inferior to champs with skillshots,as long as the skillshotchamp is played by someone competent.

Even worse is the fact that champs without skillshots tend to be even more opressive when ahead,because you can't really outplay them.

Morg's kit is actually... somewhat fluid if you chain things together properly. That said, it's all buffers. There're no cancels, and with no instant-cast abilities the only simultaneous cast is WE. WE's actually bad, since it actually delays the E cast, which is almost instant normally (but not quite - it has a tiiiny cast time). With WE,  the E doesn't start casting until just before the W cast completes, so they land at the same time. Every other combo has to be sequential, so while most things buffer really well, it's critical to know exactly what you're doing in what order. Only one it makes _significantly_ easier is QE, since it lets you move your mouse around after targeting E but before it casts. The advantage from that is pretty minimal, though. Most of the buffering is just about flow and personal comfort. It can help with lag, of course, but if you have lag problems Morgana is probably not a good champ for you anyways. xD
Her spellshield and passive are extremely out of place when it comes to the flow of her kit.

Depends on her role, but I generally agree on passive and disagree on E. For teamfights where you're not the primary engage, E is actually incredibly important, especially if you don't want to buy Protobelt. It can really be a problem to get past CC to position for ult otherwise, even with flash up, since she's fairly squish and very immobile. For pushing, _both_ are important - E for CC, and passive because have you seen how much damage a full-AP Morgana's W does to a minion wave? That said, passive is def. out of place overall.

What fits totally depends on her rework theming. Focus on the "freedom from kayle's tyranny" side of things and the E, and you could get a powerful anti-CC support - drop her R for something reflecting Kayle's (maybe something similar to a Locket active with a very brief spellshield attached?), give her a movespeed passive of some sort, and then make her W less about zone control and more about consistent %missing health damage.

 Focus on her amazing CC/teamfight, and you could drop her E for an engage tool (dash?) and attach a brief self-spellshield to it. Passive would probably be something combo-ish - extended CC on the next spell if you can do something mildly difficult and inconsistent? 

Focus on the "Fallen Angel" darkness/corruption/damage side of things, and you could drop her Q and R's CC duration, but extend it while the target is in her W. Either put some sort of %current/%missing health DoT in her passive OR attached the CC duration extension to her passive. Drop the E entirely and either replace it with some sort of debuff or with a Grounding effect of some sort.

Obviously none of this is balanced in the least, and some of it is ridiculously broken or blatantly terrible, but we're talking theming and what would "fit". Most of these I'd actually kinda dislike in key ways, though. It'll be interesting to see how they go about updating her. I doubt they'll break her for me, since most of my favorite things about her are pretty core, but we'll see!

What I really do hope is that they flesh out her character thoroughly, make her vastly more interesting (and hopefully less edgy T.T), and give her some decent voice lines. Def. looking forward to the visual update part. Pretty much every skin of her's but Lunar Wraith has something that looks incredibly wonky, and her base skin + Blade Mistress are both just... terrible. Blade Mistress even suffers from pizza ~~feet~~ dress still. It'd be nice if she kept at least one skin where her top is something more than just a bra, too, but idk how realistic it is to expect that.

I created a Kayle and Morgana concept rework not long ago.
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/xplEurem-rework-concept-kayle-and-morgana

I was thinking that Kayle should be a range champion with her passive giving her a cone AoE damage.
Morgana was oriented so she could go back mid, but she can still be acsupport for her CC and grounding effects instead of being a shield bot.

I'm pretty sure one of the biggest goals with Kayle is to weaken her ulti, not strengthen it. Maybe even swap away from it. Riot doesn't seem to like full invulnerability very much, and if they shift Kayle away from the Support role they apparently originally thought she'd be in, there's less of a point to it.

As for Morg, I do like the idea for the retribution shield. Sorta goes away from the "freedom" anti-CC stuff and more to a "revenge" theme, but that works well. I really dislike your ulti change, though. A huge part of her ult is positioning to maximize the number of enemies hit. Having a 3s channel where you're rewarded for having everyone _right_ next to you as an _incredibly_ squishy, immobile mage seems like an unintuitive mechanic that'd either make her ult fairly useless (since her ult is already an extremely long stun, you'd have to lower the CC duration further away rather than raise it nearby) or make her build tank (which is so much worse).

In fact, your Morg rework in general looks _super_ tanky. Flat passive HP regen based on minions killed, damage reflection, and an ult that wants you immediately adjacent to your targets for an extended period of time. In fact Morg's Q already rewards you for staying close to your target (seriously, that projectile is slow), and her W is best if you can force them to stand in it if they want to fight her - less need to chain your Q-R combo to get the full W duration that way. This'd shut down any hope she'd have of being a mid mage. In fact, I'm pretty sure that rework would make her a top-lane split push/teamfight tank, similar to Shen. After all, her shove at level 5+ is already pretty amazing. She can pretty much put a W on the caster minions and walk away, and the lane will autopush (in fact, that's the standard backing strategy for me when I take her TT bot - force/wait for the foe to back, W the casters, Q any cannons (or lacking that, a melee) for the extra gold, then b. It bounces by the time you're back. Doesn't work if they're pushed past the middle of lane towards you until you have first item, but after that you can bounce or autopush any empty lane whenever you want.

Don't take this the wrong way, mind - I like some of the ideas and themes in general. They just need a bit of a perspective and role shift. :)

For W, maybe it should gives her HP based on her total mana, so she has to go a mana build like moremoliccon or roa. As for her ult, you could prob decrease the range of the tether but at the same reduce its channel duration.

As for Kayle, the idea for her ult was to make it have a much bigger CD but, if timed correctly, she is rewarded for it, instead of having it up every 45 second when she is lvl 16 with 40% cdr.

Disagree on the Black Shield.
Her E and Q are basically the only things i think of when i think about Morgana. Her passive (in my opinion) is just an ability that's rarely appreciated for the sustain it provides but that might be good for a mid Morgana (the one role she really isn't being played in a lot anymore) and it is an absolutely useless ability for the bot lane.

I'm split on her ult, to be honest.
For one, her Q is such a long range ability that i can't think of a reason why would a squishy Morgana want to be in the middle of the enemy team in order to maximize its usage.
At least, the usage should make her a bit more durable in some aspects, rather than requiring an actual Item to be a decent and somewhat safe ability to use. I play her like a long range mage anyway so her ult is just a wasted ability on me. I'd rather not simply go into the enemy team as i'm not Karthus.

What feels even worse is that if you buy Zhonya's, your ult usage is tied to Zhonya's CD of 120 seconds in order to use it effectively. Your actual R CD is irrelevant, if you need to initiate a teamfight. The only way i use my R without a Zhonya's is when i'm trying to scout for invisible enemies (your ult reveals them and becomes available only when they are in range) or when my ally is already under fire and i'm trying to buy time or force the enemy to back off from them.

Her W is a good waveclear tool and essential to her mid lane but if you're playing her as a support, that ability is just being used to proc TD or generate easy gold from FCQ. That's it. It's a waste of mana. Even for her mid lane, that's just a waveclear tool and without her Q hitting the enemy, there's just no way anyone's going to stand in it willingly. I'm completely for reworking this ability or replacing it for something better and much more satisfying to use.

All in all, Morgana might still be a super scaling AP mage but her abilities all require Q to hit. An enemy who is very mobile and the one who outranges you is going to be a real problem. Her Black Shield is an ability that's useless when facing an AD assassin like Zed and Talon. She has too many weaknesses that the enemy can exploit to counter her. Even countering her slightly makes her entire kit unreliable.

#TL;DR

The abilities i think make Morgana... well, Morgana are Q and E. This is the core of her kit.
Passive and W can be changed. The ult depends on these two abilities first. Giving her incentive or statuses for going into melee is a must, not buying a Zhonya's. If this doesn't happen, just rework it as well.



Even if i'm a Morgana main, it doesn't mean that every Morgana main would agree with me. Everyone has something they'd like to remove or keep. But in any case, i've never really given her eventual rework much thought, in terms of what exactly i'd like to see from it. _**But most definitely i'd like for her to be an antithesis to Kayle and that even her kits would reflect their lore, personalities and convictions.**_ I most definitely like Morgana's "cather" side and i would like her to remain a burst combo mage.

_Sincerely, a Morgana main._

One Morgana Main to another, I understand a lot of what you're saying, and it makes sense. I generally play her in the mid slot, and while I'd be okay with Riot changing things, I'd want them to be very careful.

Her passive and W are actually great balance levers, as they are now. Want to buff Mid Morgana, but not Support? Up the passive from 10%-20% to 15%-30%, and lower the mana costs on W from 70-85-100-115-130 to 70-80-90-100-110. There. Support Morgana is basically untouched while Mid Morgana got a sizable boost.

**Listing things that are important to me as Mid Morg**

Fast efficient wave clear from early levels with minimal payment.

High threat-pick potential by herself when hitting a Q.

The E shield CC immunity, especially the way it combines with her innate sustain to make it really hard to shove/dive Morgana off the wave.

High counter-engage (Mid Morgana is obnoxiously good at this).

Levers for Riot to pull so that, if Morgana hits a situation where she's 45% Mid win rate, and 54% Support Win rate, they can change it so she's 49%-51% respectively. Aka, I want her as a Mid, not as a Support.

**Things I'd be willing to give up**

The passive. While I like it in terms of sustain, provided Riot meets the above, I'd be more than happy for something more inventive.

Her ultimate, while I really enjoy it (especially for the Lvl 6 100-0 flash all in), it does give her this "I want to be forever away, but then Go Ham for 3 seconds). Granted, this is part of the balance lever on the ultimate, and her anti-synergy with this spell is why Morgana is allowed to have it. If they wanted to go more of a battlefield control/artillery direction, I could get behind that.

I will note that her ult *does* have use cases, partly based on when the enemy dives your team, and your ability to build bulky enough to not be insta-gibbed up until the late game.

Puddle could also go, but I'm not sure how they'd fit her with a kit that has 'safe' and 'has wave clear' without it, or something very similar. That said, it *is* kind of slaved to the Q for anything PvP related.

The Q and E are sacred, though. Perfect spells.


If anything, I'd like to see Morgana be pulled *away* from the Zhoynas interaction. League Of Mobility makes that not work out, combined with Zhoynas being crippled **so** hard stat wise, I just almost never buy the thing anymore.

I'm used to this Morgana and i've grown to like her and play her like she already is.
But her kit design is pretty dated, even if it's still as strong as it used to be. But having a lot of mobility options in League nowadays, puts her kit into the bin most of the times. Her Q has quite a fair speed and hitbox and the only mastery currently you can display as a Morgana main is your ability to hit snares consistently, in multitude of situations.

That's a pretty low bar to try to hit. Her mastery curve leaves a lot to be desired. Now, this doesn't mean she has to become a lot more complicated mage (like Katarina for example) but just that there has to be more options for Morgana players to show their growth.

And just as you've said, her W is a slave to her Q. In mid lane, it's an important thing for her to manage minion waves so you'd want to level her W anyway, because hitting her Q on max range (and quite possibly having to deal with minions as well) isn't worth the early points.
Her snare duration is really high (2 seconds base) and that's pretty much you'd want to care about in ganks. It can be a 1 point wonder ability, given the low mobility matchups. Her Q's CD is static anyway.

In terms of how much change i'd expect from her in the future, i don't really know.
I think her design is solid but just needs modernization (same as Warwick). I don't think she needs Galio level or work (everything new) but if Riot basically keeps her core familiar to us Morgana players, i don't think i would mind it even if she looked a bit different. In any case, i know Riot's going to fit the design with the narrative and that she wouldn't look out of place.
But i'm just too used to her "bra with a dress" look, that's a part of her charm for me.
